abstract.t: This document defines the Signature-Key HTTP header field for distributing public keys used to verify HTTP Message Signatures as defined in RFC 9421. Four initial key distribution schemes are defined: pseudonymous inline keys (hwk), identified signers with JWKS URI discovery (jwks_uri), X.509 certificate chains (x509), and JWT- based delegation (jwt). These schemes enable flexible trust models ranging from privacy-preserving pseudonymous verification to PKI- based identity chains and horizontally-scalable delegated authentication.
